item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Gold for Galal Yafai, Tom Daley takes bronze & madison silver for Walls and Hayter
item.description: Tom Daley claims bronze in the men's 10m platform after boxer Galal Yafai wins Team GB's first boxing gold in Tokyo to become Olympic flyweight champion.

item.title: Covid: Wales moves to alert level zero with most rules scrapped
item.description: Social distancing ends, but face masks are still needed in shops and on public transport.

item.title: Covid-19: Happy clubbers as rules end in Wales, and PM will not isolate
item.description: Five things you need to know about the coronavirus pandemic this Saturday morning.

item.title: Archbishop of York: English people feel left behind by metropolitan elites
item.description: Many English people are "patronised as backwardly xenophobic", the Archbishop of York says.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: German pentathlon coach thrown out for punching horse
item.description: A German coach who appeared to strike a horse with her fist during the modern pentathlon is thrown out of the Olympics.

item.title: Cash prize jackpot offered for double-jabbed students
item.description: A university hopes to boost Covid jab take-up among students by offering 10 Â£5,000 cash prizes.

item.title: Climate change: New report will highlight 'stark reality' of warming
item.description: The IPCC's short scientific summary due out on Monday will be strongest statement yet on climate change.

item.title: Apple criticised for system that detects child abuse
item.description: There are privacy concerns that the system will be expanded to scan phones for political speech.

item.title: Afghanistan war: Taliban say jail captured and prisoners freed
item.description: Video on social media shows hundreds of inmates leaving the Afghan jail after heavy militant attacks.

item.title: Wood Green stabbing: Man and police officers attacked in north London
item.description: The attack is not thought to be terrorism related and three people have been arrested, police said.

item.title: Greece fires spread uncontrolled, killing a fireman
item.description: Thousands of people are being evacuated as uncontrolled fires continue to rage.

item.title: University clearing may be 'much more competitive' this year - Ucas boss
item.description: "It's still a good year for clearing," says the admissions service boss, ahead of results day next week.

item.title: The Papers: 'No more lockdowns', and Team GB's medal haul
item.description: A mix of stories make Saturday's front pages, but Great Britain's Olympics success features on many.

item.title: Afghan interpreter: 'A better life for my wife and children in the UK'
item.description: Afghan interpreters who worked with British forces are being relocated to the UK, as the Taliban advance.

item.title: Week in pictures: 31 July - 6 August 2021
item.description: A selection of powerful images taken around the world this week.

item.title: 'They call me the Irish hulk of basketball'
item.description: Aidan Igiehon is part of a group of elite Irish athletes playing college basketball in America.

item.title: Dead Ringers impressionists on how Covid changed their work
item.description: Impressionists Jon Culshaw, Jan Ravens and Debra Stephenson on their ever-changing political material.

item.title: Getting more black women into cycling
item.description: Members of Black Girls Do Bike say the ever-growing group feels like a 'sisterhood'

item.title: Telfar Clemens: Designer creates Tokyo 2020 Olympic outfits for Team Liberia
item.description: American-Liberian designer Telfar Clemens created Liberian team's outfits at the Tokyo Olympics.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: Olympic athletes struggle with heat at Games
item.description: This games are one of the warmest on record, with many athletes complaining about the high temperatures.

item.title: 'We want trillions to heal our wounds'
item.description: Descendants of victims of Germany's atrocities in Namibia say the money offered is not nearly enough.

item.title: Ryan Reynolds: Why Free Guy is more than a 'video game movie'
item.description: The Canadian actor's latest film sees him play a different kind of "naÃ¯ve and innocent" character.

item.title: COP26: What is the UN climate conference in Glasgow and why is it so important?
item.description: The annual climate change summit is being held in Glasgow - who's going and what's at stake?

item.title: Sky Brown inspiring skateboarding girls to take it 'to the next level'
item.description: Girls in the West share how the skateboarding Olympics has inspired them to take their hobby further.

item.title: Mayflower 400 years: How many people are related to the Mayflower pilgrims?
item.description: For some, the17th century "pilgrim fathers" are also real-life ancestors. But for how many?

item.title: Belarus crackdown fails to crush opposition spirit
item.description: Beaten up, jailed, forced into exile - protesters are still battling against President Lukashenko.

item.title: Capturing the disappearing sounds of the workplace
item.description: An archive preserving sounds from offices, factories and shops will also be a resource for artists and musicians.

item.title: The activist entrepreneurs running zero-waste shops
item.description: Environmentally conscious entrepreneurs explain the movement towards zero-waste lifestyles.

item.title: Energy price cap: What is it and how does it affect my bills?
item.description: The regulator Ofgem announces that the energy price cap will rise - but how does it work?

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: GB's Galal Yafai beats Carlo Paalam to win flyweight boxing gold
item.description: Watch the best moments from the men's flyweight final as Great Britain's Galal Yafai beats Carlo Paalam of the Philippines to win gold at Tokyo 2020.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: GB's Matt Walls and Ethan Hayter win silver in men's madison with strong last lap
item.description: A strong final lap from Team GB's Matt Walls and Ethan Hayter helps them win silver in the men's madison at Tokyo 2020.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Great Britain's Tom Daley wins bronze in the men's 10m platform
item.description: Great Britain's Tom Daley wins his fourth Olympic medal with a bronze in the men's 10m platform at Tokyo 2020.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Brazil's Hebert Sousa wins men's middleweight gold by knockout against Oleksandr Khyzhniak
item.description: Brazil's Hebert Sousa wins gold in the men's middleweight boxing by knocking out Ukraine's Oleksandr Khyzhniak with a brilliant punch.

item.title: 'There's been cynicism, anger and frustration' - O'Gara wants Lions 'spark' to save series
item.description: The British and Irish Lions' decisive third Test in South Africa "has huge implications for the future of rugby", says three-time tourist Ronan O'Gara.

item.title: Lakers sign Westbrook & Anthony as Curry extends Warriors deal
item.description: The Los Angeles Lakers acquire Russell Westbrook and Carmelo Anthony while Stephen Curry signs a new deal with the Golden State Warriors worth a reported $215m (Â£155m).

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Daley wins bronze in men's 10m platform as Cao makes history
item.description: GB's Tom Daley wins bronze in men's 10m platform at Tokyo 2020 as China's Cao Yuan makes history.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Galal Yafai wins men's flyweight boxing gold with victory over Carlo Paalam
item.description: Britain's Galal Yafai wins Olympic gold in the men's 52kg flyweight boxing competition with a win over Carlo Paalam of the Philippines.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Cyclists Matt Walls and Ethan Hayter win silver in men's madison
item.description: British cyclist Matt Walls' superb Olympic debut continues as he wins a second Tokyo medal with silver in the men's madison alongside Ethan Hayter.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Team USA beat France 87-82 to claim fourth straight gold medal
item.description: USA beat France to win their fourth basketball gold medal in a row.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Day-by-day guide to the key events, big stars and British medal hopes
item.description: Want to know what's happening when in Tokyo? Check out our comprehensive guide to all the action in Japan.

item.title: Eurovision, Euro 2020 and Tokyo 2020 Olympics - Italy's golden summer
item.description: "This is Italy's moment of glory" - after Eurovision & Euro 2020 victories, an Italian Wimbledon finalist, now comes Olympics history in Tokyo.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Great Britain win 4x100m relay silver and bronze
item.description: Britain's sprint relay teams deliver silver and bronze medals, with the men's quartet missing out on the 4x100m title by just a hundredth of a second.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Kate French storms to modern pentathlon gold for Great Britain
item.description: Kate French storms away from the field with a dominant run in the final event of the modern pentathlon to earn Great Britain's 18th gold of the Tokyo Olympics.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Laura Kenny and Katie Archibald win historic gold in women's madison
item.description: Laura Kenny becomes the first British woman to win gold at three Olympic Games as she and Katie Archibald are crowned madison champions in Tokyo.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Britain's Laura Muir wins silver in 1500m behind Kenya's Faith Kipyegon
item.description: Great Britain's Laura Muir ends her quest for a major outdoor medal as she wins silver in the 1500m final at Tokyo 2020.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics medal table - which country has won most golds?
item.description: Which country is leading the medal table? How are Great Britain getting on? Medals table for the 2020 Olympics in Tokyo.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Great Britain win bronze in thriller against India
item.description: Watch highlights as Great Britain's women win hockey bronze by beating India 4-3 in a dramatic match at the Oi Hockey Stadium in Tokyo.

item.title: Indian women's hockey: Sixteen stories of struggle, one tale of triumph
item.description: Fighting until the very end, India go down 3-4 to Great Britain in the bronze medal playoff.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: The 'buzz' of winning a bronze medal
item.description: Many athletes go into the Olympic games wanting gold, but for some, making the podium is enough.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Team GB's Matt Walls wins omnium gold
item.description: Team GB cyclist Matt Walls is crowned Olympic champion on his debut with a dominant performance in the men's omnium.

item.title: Alex Yee: 'I didn't feel worthy to stand on the start line'
item.description: Alex Yee, 23, won two medals at the Olympics - but had self-worth issues when he first turned pro.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Galal Yafai beats Saken Bibossinov to reach flyweight final
item.description: Great Britain's Galal Yafai reaches the Olympic flyweight final with a thrilling win over Saken Bibossinov of Kazakhstan.

item.title: Peter Bol: The Sudanese-Australian runner who lifted a nation
item.description: Peter Bol's Olympics has delighted Australians, becoming a "symbol of what we can aspire to be".

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Liverpool millionaire aiding GB's medal haul
item.description: Barrie Wells sponsored Olympic silver medallist Keely Hodgkinson after she failed to get funding.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Britain's Liam Heath claims bronze in men's kayak single 200m
item.description: Great Britain's Liam Heath claims a bronze medal after a "hesitant start" to the defence of his Olympic men's kayak single 200m.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Keegan Palmer wins first men's park skateboarding gold
item.description: Australian 18-year-old Keegan Palmer wins gold in the first Olympic men's park skateboarding final at Tokyo 2020.

item.title: Covid rules: What's changing in Wales, Scotland, England and Northern Ireland
item.description: Major changes to lockdown rules have taken effect in England and Scotland, but some restrictions remain.

item.title: Covid: What are the social distancing rules across the UK?
item.description: Social distancing rules are changing across the UK.

item.title: âCovid passportsâ: How to get the NHS Covid Pass
item.description: People in England can use the pass for travel and to visit venues which ask for them.

item.title: What are the travel rules for Spain, Portugal, Malta and other holiday hotspots?
item.description: What you need to know about going to Portugal, Spain, Greece, France, Malta, Italy and Turkey.

item.title: Covid-19 in the UK: How many coronavirus cases are there in my area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: What are the holiday rules for travel to green, amber and red list countries?
item.description: The government has updated its red, amber and green lists of countries.

item.title: Covid-19: Five ways to avoid catching the virus indoors
item.description: As social distancing restrictions end in England and ease in Scotland, good ventilation remains vital.

item.title: Covid: What do under-30s need to know about the vaccine?
item.description: The government is expected to announce that 16 and 17-year-olds will receive the Covid vaccine.

item.title: Long Covid: What is it and what are the symptoms?
item.description: New research links as many as 200 different symptoms to the condition.

item.title: Covid: When will teenagers get the jab and do I need a booster?
item.description: More teenagers will be able to receive the Covid vaccine, and a third jab will soon be available for the most vulnerable.

item.title: Coronavirus: How does the NHS test-and-trace system and app work?
item.description: The number of people pinged by the Covid app has fallen significantly.

item.title: Covid: Which children are being vaccinated and why?
item.description: Hundreds of thousands of children at higher risk from coronavirus infection will be offered a Covid vaccine in the UK.

item.title: What are the Delta, Gamma, Beta and Alpha Covid variants?
item.description: UK coronavirus cases are rising due to a variant first identified in India that spreads more easily.

item.title: Lockdown muscle loss: Five ways to get back in shape
item.description: Lockdown inactivity may have left people with weaker muscles - there are simple solutions.
